Description: Colour pale red. Genital field with a sexual dimorphism in number and density of medial genital plate setae: ♂♂ : 50 – 100, ratio setae number/plate L 0.24 – 0.38, ♀♀ : 28 – 48, ratio 0.15 – 0.20.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 14. Family Hydrodromidae , genus
Hydrodroma
. a.–c.
H. amoenoderma ,
female (MD 097); a. integument papillae; b. palp; c. coxal and genital field; d.–g.
H. poseidon
female (MNHN B 16 C); d. integument papillae; e. Cx-I+II; f. III-L-4–6 (detail. trident setae at higher magnification); g. IV-L-4–6.

subSubSection.paragraph: Derivatio nominis: amoenus (Latin), pleasant, and derma (Greek: δέρμα), skin.

Remarks:
Hydrodroma amoenoderma
has many features in common with
H. torrenticola (Walter, 1908)
from the northern hemisphere: (1) Integument papillae of two types , larger ones (with rounded tips) surrounded by smaller ones arranged in a hexagonal pattern; (2) Cx-I with a smooth medial margin; (3) swimming setation well developed (on IV-L-5 on both surfaces), but posterior surfaces of II-L-5 bearing only one, of IV-L-5 less than 10 swimming setae; (4) claws moderately developed (8 – 14 % L penultimate segment).
Hydrodroma torrenticola
differs from
H. amoenoderma
in (1) a weaker development of the hexagonal smaller integument papillae (developed as flattened projections, not reaching 50% H of main papillae); (2) a more slender chelicera (total L/H> 5.3); (3) a stouter P-4 (variability with a slight overlap, L/H 4.1 – 4.6); (4) lower numbers of swimming setae on III-L (n posterior setae III-L-4, ♂♂ 8, ♀♀ 5 – 9, III-L-5, ♂♂ 4 – 7, ♀♀ , 4 – 6). A further difference concerns the genital field: In contrast to
H. amoenoderma
, no distinct sexual dimorphism is found in number and density of medial genital plate setae of
H. torrenticola
( ♂♂ : 32 – 53, ratio setae number/plate L 0.13 – 0.20, ♀♀ : 25 – 40, ratio 0.11 – 0.16).
Habitat: Pools of streams, mostly in open, unforested landscapes.
Distribution: Madagascar ; in many parts of the island, but not found in the high mountains and in the high north.
